alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 15 at 6:07PM MST until February 16 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT WEDNESDAY FROM 11 AM TO 6 PM MST FOR THE EAST CENTRAL PLAINS... .Humidities will continue to weaken through early evening so the Red Flag Warning for today has been allowed to expire. Winds will also trend weaker this evening, except over the mountains of west central New Mexico, where gusty winds are likely to continue through tonight. After borderline poor humidity recovery east central plains tonight, strong southwest winds will return there on Wednesday with gusts reaching up to 55 mph. Humidities will again plummet below 15 percent across east central areas Wednesday afternoon, and high temperatures will vary around 5 to 10 degrees above normal, with another round of critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 6 PM MST WEDNESDAY... ...RED FLAG WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 6 PM MST THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...East Central Plains from 11 AM to 6 PM MST Wednesday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 25 to 40 mph with gusts to around 55 mph Wednesday afternoon. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 10 to 15 percent Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
